cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the Louisiana coast, then inland through the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near southeast-central Louisiana) late Friday night

weather_observation.impacted_coast: coasts of southeast and central Louisiana and coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate coastal flooding with tides potentially several feet above normal along Plaquemines Parish shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with local maxima up to 8 inches; flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday night through Saturday morning
